intro: Weberbauerocereus fascicularis, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a cactus species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stems that are often branched and covered in spines. The plant produces large, fragrant white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its flowers are typically followed by small, red fruits that contain edible seeds. This species is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
